clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: For the control of tonic clonic grand mal and complex partial psychomotor seizures

contraindications.disease: Symptoms of overdose include drowsiness loss of or impaired muscle coordination nausea visual disturbance and at very high doses coma
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Ethotoin is a hydantoin derivative and anticonvulsant Ethotoin exerts an antiepileptic effect without causing general central nervous system depression The mechanism of action is probably very similar to that of phenytoin The latter drug appears to stabilize rather than to raise the normal seizure threshold and to prevent the spread of seizure activity rather than to abolish the primary focus of seizure discharges
